content:
re : I appreciate that the All Mail folder keeps emails even after they have been deleted from the Inbox

That depends on how you are using the 'Delete'. But in general I would say that is not the normal expectation.

All emails are stored in 'All Mail' In an Imap account : If you delete an email and have it auto put into the gmail Trash folder then gmail will auto delete emails older than 30 days from Trash and also auto delete them from 'All Mail'.

If you do not auto put deleted mail into gmail Trash, you are in effect by-passing the gmail TRash, then gmail understands that to mean 'Do not Delete email' just delete the 'label' and then Archive the email in 'All Mail'. So you still have it - it just does not have any labels attached to it.

In 'Account Settings' > 'Server Settings' for gmail account 'When I delete a message' To put email you delete into the gmail Trash: 'Move it to this folder Select 'Trash on gmail email address' In my case gmail have called the Trash folder 'Bin' - seems some brits have a 'Bin' as 'Trash'

But What option have you got selected ? It's important we understand what you have got set up.

Also how do you delete ? What buttons or icons or keyboard keys do you use ? Just wondering if you are deliberately using 'Shift'+'Del'.

If things are reappearing and you have an issue with 'All Mail', then it sounds like this may be due to a lack of compacting. But regardless there may be some corruption. The 'Inbox', 'Drafts' and 'Spam' usually get the most activity when it comes to moving or deleting emails, so those 3 folders should get compacted on a regualr basis. Personally, I do it every day before exiting Thunderbird. But in your case you also have the 'All Mail' and that means usually it also needs compacting because it has everything. But in this instance, do not compact 'All Mail'.

under 'Message Storage' Select 'Clean up (Expunge) Inbox on Exit'

This then auto compacts the Inbox on exit cleaning up all the old traces of moved or deleted emails. This is good housekeeping and helps to maintain a healthy mbox file. But please remember to not exit/close down computer too quickly as Thunderbird will be performing background processes. The alternative would be to not set the auto expunge/compact, but remember to do it manually before exiting, so you can be sure it has finished before you close Thunderbird.

Basically 'All Mail' is a massive file as it contains everything - incoming, saved in other folders, junk/spam, outgoing, archived - everything all in one place. Basically, it just means you have a complete duplicate - two of everything in one account.

Normally, I would advise people not to subscribe to the 'All Mail' because it's just a duplicate and uses up space on C: drive and in Thunderbird, it can be an enormous mbox file. That means every single email is in one single text document. If it should get corrupted, it may effect every email you have in any folder. If you have Anti-Virus installed as is the case with Windows OS (I note you are on Linux) then it can try to auto fix any files it does not like and this may result in a complete loss of emails. Even if you do not have an Anti-Virus performing anything, that 'All Mail' folder needs regular compacting. That means recreating a second copy that just contains emails not marked as deleted, so that's another copy before the original is deleted. You do not want any corruption occuring with that mbox file.

If you directly delete any email from the 'All Mail' folder then it gets auto deleted from Inbox or any imap folder.

DO THIS: I would advise you to 'unsubscribe' from seeing that 'All Mail' folder because it's too risky to compact it.

Then restart Thunderbird so it just removes the 'All Mail' data. Manually compact the 'Inbox', 'Drafts' and 'Spam'. Right click on folder and select 'Compact' Do each folder in turn.


re : Thunderbird 115.16.0esr (64-bit) Is there any reason why you have not updated to a newer version of Thunderbird ?

content:
re : I have enabled the Thunderbird dark mode.

I'm assuming you use Windows OS. What computer setting have you set up for apps ?

  • In Windows search type: Settings
  • Select 'Settings'
  • Select 'Personalisation'
  • Select 'Colours'

'Choose your colour'

  • click on the drop down and select 'Custom'

'Choose your default app mode'

  • Select 'Dark'

You should see an example at the top of that window and it should show 'Sample Text' using white font on dark background.

Where it says 'Choose your accent colour' Whatever colour you choose may get used for titles and buttons in Thunderbird depending upon some settings.

Confirm you have the 'dark' settings for apps.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
In Thunderbird

Click on the menu app icon (3 lines) select 'Addons & Themes' Select 'Themes' By default there will be 'System theme', 'Light' and 'Dark' You have selected 'Dark'

Have you installed another theme ? If yes, you need to remove any theme you have installed. It's not enough to be disabled. Please click on the 3 dot icon on the right side of the theme and select 'Remove' Then exit Thunderbird. Wait a few moments for background processes to complete and then restart Thunderbird.
creator: Toad-Hall

Hello there We have read the question We try to help

I could not get connected to the server. That error message appeared on that desktop or laptop screen.


The first thing to do is to create a new profile and to move the bookmarks that are there to the other profile ,then things are fixed and you are ok to use the new profile and remove the old one.

Also VPN use could block certain subjects. Try to turnt it off and see if it solve some of the issue s here . Antivirus programs like Avast, Kaspersky ,BitDefender ,the use of them could or can behave aggressively to some other subjects of use from it like blocking traffic and that is creating that error of you ,it might be that the method of syncing with some desktop and mobile devices with the use of WiFi or cable usage ,that Firefox profile of that version is getting that error and can be corrupted of that use of that sync method that way , even with normal use of sync method ,try to get a new profile in the latest software release from Thunderbird.

Greetings Firefox volunteer

content:
La tua situazione è analoga a quella descritta qui? -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=79226.0

Inoltre, Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)

content:
Bu durumda SMTP sunucularınızı kontrol edelim.

Menü > Hesap ayarları"'na girin. Sol taraftan Giden sunucusu (SMTP) ekranına girin. Burada iki ayrı hesabınız iki ayrı sunucu görüyor olmalısınız. Ayarları aynı ama kullanıcı adları farklı olmalı.

İlkini seçip Düzenle'ye tıklayın. Kullanıcı adı alanında gördüğünüz e-posta adresini Tanım alanına da yazın. Aynı işlemi diğer sunucu için de yapın. Bu sayede az sonra yapacağımız işlemde bu sunucuları birbirinden ayırt edebileceğiz.

Şimdi sol taraftan cigdem.cengiz@... şeklindeki hesabınızı seçin. Ekranın en altındaki Giden sunucusu (SMTP) ayarını kontrol edin. Doğru e-posta adresine ait doğru sunucu seçilmiş görünüyor mu? Doğru değilse doğrusunu seçin.
creator: maxcoder
